title: Where To Sell Old Coins – 10 Best Places
description: Are you looking for the best place to sell old coins? We’ve all looked at an old coin at some point and wondered, ‘Is this worth anything?’ Whether it’s a rare find from pocket change, a unique gift from a relative, or a long-forgotten collection, old coins can sometimes be worth something. I remember the... The post Where To Sell Old Coins – 10 Best Places appeared first on Making Sense Of Cents.
author: Alexis Schroeder
excerpt: Wondering where is best to sell old coins? Here are 10 best places to sell old coins, plus how to find out how much your coins are worth!
text: Are you looking for the best place to sell old coins? We’ve all looked at an old coin at some point and wondered, ‘Is this worth anything?’ Whether it’s a rare find from pocket change, a unique gift from a relative, or a long-forgotten collection, old coins can sometimes be worth something. I remember the… Are you looking for the best place to sell old coins? We’ve all looked at an old coin at some point and wondered, ‘Is this worth anything?’ Whether it’s a rare find from pocket change, a unique gift from a relative, or a long-forgotten collection, old coins can sometimes be worth something. I remember the first time I found a few coins that were passed down to me. At first, I had no idea where to start, but I quickly learned that these small pieces of history could actually be worth something. Whether you’re looking to sell vintage treasures passed down to you or have a collection you’re ready to get rid of, these coins may be worth more than you think. This can be a great way to make extra money! Best Places To Sell Old Coins Below are the best places to sell old coins. Recommended reading: Where To Cash Coins Near Me 1. Local coin shops Local coin shops are the most straightforward option for selling old coins. You can start by researching the value of your coins using online guides, price books, or coin grading services. When visiting local coin shops, bring your coins in a neatly organized manner which makes sure they’re shown in the best condition. Bring any important certifications or documents about your coins. The dealer has an appraisal process and may even give you free evaluations. I do recommend that you get quotes from several coin shops to make sure you’re getting a fair price for your coins. Keep in mind, that coin shops need to make a profit, so their offer will be lower than retail value. However, selling your coins at a local coin shop can save you time and hassle of online listings or auctions. 2. Coin shows  Coin shows are a way to sell coins directly to collectors in a marketplace. You can research upcoming coin shows and check exhibitor lists to get an idea if the event attracts buyers interested in your type of coins. Then, organize your collection and bring any relevant documentation to help build buyer confidence. When arriving at coin shows, visit dealer tables and ask if they are interested in purchasing your coins. If selling directly to attendees, you’d need to rent a booth to show your coin collection.  This method of selling old coins is great if you want to get fair prices and engage with people who are enthusiastic about coins. 3. eBay  eBay is a popular option to sell old coins (and to sell any other stuff) since the site reaches people all around the world. You can get started by creating an eBay seller account if you don’t already have one. Then, take high-quality photos of your coins, capturing both sides of the coins and any unique details. The listing description should include any information about the coin’s condition, year, mint mark, and certifications. You can choose to set a price or auction depending on your selling strategy. My sister has sold many items on eBay over the years (as well as other people I know), and it’s a great place to sell items to a worldwide audience. 4. Heritage Auctions Heritage Auctions is a global platform for collectors who buy and sell rare or valuable pieces. To get started, visit the Heritage Auctions website and submit a free appraisal request. You simply just tell them what you want to sell with a quick description of your coins. Then, upload high-quality photos of your coins. Heritage Auctions experts will look at your coin collection and recommend the best auction format, including live auctions, internet-only sales, or private transactions. Once your coins are accepted, Heritage Auctions will handle cataloging, photography, and marketing to attract buyers. They do charge a seller’s commission which is deducted from the final sale price. 5. APMEX APMEX (American Precious Metals Exchange) is a platform for people who want to sell bullion, rare coins, or collectible currency. You can simply just go to the APMEX website and go to their “Sell to Us” page. This page allows you to submit an online quote or to give them a phone call. Once you accept the quote, you’ll receive shipping instructions. Once APMEX receives your coins, they’ll verify the coins and finalize the offer to you. They send payment via check, wire transfer, or direct deposit. 6. JM Bullion JM Bullion has a secure process for people wanting to sell bullion coins. To get started selling on JM Bullion, go to their “Sell to Us” page, where you can also review their current buyback prices. These prices are updated regularly to match current market conditions. The “Sell to Us” page lets you select the type of products you want to sell, how much you’re selling, and your personal information. So, this site makes it super easy to sell your coins! Once the sale is agreed upon, JM Bullion will provide shipping instructions to make sure that your coins arrive safely. They’ll verify the quality and weight of your coins before finalizing the transaction. Payment is sent via check or bank transfer. 7. Cash For Gold USA Cash For Gold USA is a convenient option if you’re looking to sell your coins quickly. You can get started by visiting their website and requesting a free appraisal kit. Once you receive the kit, you can put your coins in the package (Cash For Gold USA insures shipments up to $100,000 which helps give you peace of mind). Once the package is received, their experts will take a look at your coins and determine their value based on metal content, weight, and current market prices. After the appraisal, you’ll receive an offer, which you can deny or accept. At times, they also give out a bonus for your coin. For example, when I looked at their site recently, they were giving a 10% bonus. So, if they offer you $100, then they are going to give you $110 total. Cash For Gold USA pays out via check, wire transfer, or PayPal. Recommended reading: 16 Best Selling Apps For Selling Stuff Online And Locally 8. Coin World Marketplace Coin World Marketplace is a site where you can connect with a community of coin collectors from around the world. To get started selling your coins on Coin World Marketplace, create an account on their platform and register as a seller. Then, you will just need to organize your coins, gather certifications, and take high-quality photos to post on their website. Once your coins are listed, you can talk with potential buyers and I recommend that you answer their questions quickly. Transactions are typically handled through the platform, which makes it safe and secure for both the coin seller and coin buyer. 9. Stacks & Bowers Stacks & Bowers is a platform where serious collectors CAN go to find rare or valuable pieces. You can just go to their “Sell and Consign” page where you can consign now or request an appraisal. You’ll have to give them all the details about your coins, including mint marks, certifications, or historical significance. 10. GreatCollections GreatCollections is a popular site that connects collectors with sellers. You can sell both coins and paper money on this site. To sell your coins on this site, you can just submit your coins for an appraisal through their website or by contacting them directly. If accepted, the platform will handle every part of the selling process, including photography and marketing. Frequently Asked Questions Below are the most commonly asked questions about selling old coins for money. Where is the best place to sell my coins? The best place to sell your coins depends on the type, value, and your preferred selling method (some are much easier than others!). Some of the most popular places to sell coins include local coin shops and eBay due to the convenience and quick way to sell a collection of old coins. If you want to get the most profit for your coin collection, visit an online platform that specializes in selling coin collections like Heritage Auctions or APMEX. Who gives the most money for old coins?  The value of old coins depends on several factors, including rarity, condition, historical significance, and market demand. If you want to make the most money, I recommend looking into selling your coins at auction houses like Heritage Auctions. How do I find out what my coins are worth?  To find out what your coins are worth, you can use online resources like coin price guides or online coin valuation tools like Coin Value Checker. You can also get an appraisal from a professional at a local coin shop. All kinds of coins can be worth something, such as nickels, dimes, pennies, silver bullion, palladium coins, half dollars, ancient coins (such as Roman currency), proof sets, and more. One rare coin, for example, is the Saint-Gaudens Double Eagle. How to sell coins without getting ripped off? To sell coins without getting ripped off, it’s important to know and learn as much about the coin as you can before selling anything. So, this means that you should identify your coins, get an appraisal, or use free online coin value sites. You can also check previous auctions to see what similar coins sold for. I also recommend that you take your coins to get multiple appraisals at coin shops or coin dealers. This will give you an idea of what to expect. How much is a 1965 quarter worth? The value of a 1965 quarter depends on its condition, if the coins have special features, or if the coins are rare and uncirculated. 1965 quarters in pristine, uncirculated condition sell for as much as $5,000+, whereas circulated 1965 quarters only go for less than $1.  Where to sell old coins online?  There are many places to sell old coins including eBay, Heritage Auctions, GreatCollections, and APMEX. Each way has a different appraisal process and takes different fees. Where to sell old coins for cash?  To sell old coins for cash, the best options include local coin shops, pawn shops, online bullion dealers, or auction houses like Heritage Auctions. Who buys old coins near me? Local coin shops, pawn shops, and coin shows are some of the best places to sell old coins near you. Where To Sell Old Coins – Summary I hope you enjoyed my article on the best places to sell old coins, such as silver coins, gold coins, large collections, mint sets, paper currency, and even just single coins that you may have. Whether you have a coin-collecting hobby or you just came across a coin that you think may be worth something, there are many ways to sell coins online and in person so that you can make the most money. As you can see, there are many ways and places to sell old coins. Where you decide to sell depends on how fast you’re trying to get rid of your coins, how much profit you want to make, and the level of convenience you’re looking for.  When I first explored selling coins, I was surprised by how many options there were and how exciting the process could be. Whether you’re selling an heirloom collection or coins you’ve saved over the years, it’s worth taking the time to find the best place that suits your needs. Selling coins can feel overwhelming, but there are so many options these days and it’s never been easier. Are you trying to sell old coins for cash? html:
Are you looking for the best place to sell old coins? We’ve all looked at an old coin at some point and wondered, ‘Is this worth anything?’ Whether it’s a rare find from pocket change, a unique gift from a relative, or a long-forgotten collection, old coins can sometimes be worth something. I remember the…

Are you looking for the best place to sell old coins?

We’ve all looked at an old coin at some point and wondered, ‘Is this worth anything?’ Whether it’s a rare find from pocket change, a unique gift from a relative, or a long-forgotten collection, old coins can sometimes be worth something.

I remember the first time I found a few coins that were passed down to me. At first, I had no idea where to start, but I quickly learned that these small pieces of history could actually be worth something.

Whether you’re looking to sell vintage treasures passed down to you or have a collection you’re ready to get rid of, these coins may be worth more than you think. This can be a great way to make extra money!

Best Places To Sell Old Coins

Below are the best places to sell old coins.

Recommended reading: Where To Cash Coins Near Me

1. Local coin shops

Local coin shops are the most straightforward option for selling old coins. You can start by researching the value of your coins using online guides, price books, or coin grading services.

When visiting local coin shops, bring your coins in a neatly organized manner which makes sure they’re shown in the best condition. Bring any important certifications or documents about your coins. The dealer has an appraisal process and may even give you free evaluations.

I do recommend that you get quotes from several coin shops to make sure you’re getting a fair price for your coins. Keep in mind, that coin shops need to make a profit, so their offer will be lower than retail value. However, selling your coins at a local coin shop can save you time and hassle of online listings or auctions.

2. Coin shows 

Coin shows are a way to sell coins directly to collectors in a marketplace. You can research upcoming coin shows and check exhibitor lists to get an idea if the event attracts buyers interested in your type of coins.

Then, organize your collection and bring any relevant documentation to help build buyer confidence. When arriving at coin shows, visit dealer tables and ask if they are interested in purchasing your coins. If selling directly to attendees, you’d need to rent a booth to show your coin collection. 

This method of selling old coins is great if you want to get fair prices and engage with people who are enthusiastic about coins.

3. eBay 

eBay is a popular option to sell old coins (and to sell any other stuff) since the site reaches people all around the world.

You can get started by creating an eBay seller account if you don’t already have one. Then, take high-quality photos of your coins, capturing both sides of the coins and any unique details.

The listing description should include any information about the coin’s condition, year, mint mark, and certifications. You can choose to set a price or auction depending on your selling strategy.

My sister has sold many items on eBay over the years (as well as other people I know), and it’s a great place to sell items to a worldwide audience.

4. Heritage Auctions

Heritage Auctions is a global platform for collectors who buy and sell rare or valuable pieces.

To get started, visit the Heritage Auctions website and submit a free appraisal request. You simply just tell them what you want to sell with a quick description of your coins. Then, upload high-quality photos of your coins.

Heritage Auctions experts will look at your coin collection and recommend the best auction format, including live auctions, internet-only sales, or private transactions.

Once your coins are accepted, Heritage Auctions will handle cataloging, photography, and marketing to attract buyers. They do charge a seller’s commission which is deducted from the final sale price.

5. APMEX

APMEX (American Precious Metals Exchange) is a platform for people who want to sell bullion, rare coins, or collectible currency.

You can simply just go to the APMEX website and go to their “Sell to Us” page. This page allows you to submit an online quote or to give them a phone call.

Once you accept the quote, you’ll receive shipping instructions. Once APMEX receives your coins, they’ll verify the coins and finalize the offer to you. They send payment via check, wire transfer, or direct deposit.

6. JM Bullion

JM Bullion has a secure process for people wanting to sell bullion coins.

To get started selling on JM Bullion, go to their “Sell to Us” page, where you can also review their current buyback prices. These prices are updated regularly to match current market conditions. The “Sell to Us” page lets you select the type of products you want to sell, how much you’re selling, and your personal information. So, this site makes it super easy to sell your coins!

Once the sale is agreed upon, JM Bullion will provide shipping instructions to make sure that your coins arrive safely. They’ll verify the quality and weight of your coins before finalizing the transaction. Payment is sent via check or bank transfer.

7. Cash For Gold USA

Cash For Gold USA is a convenient option if you’re looking to sell your coins quickly. You can get started by visiting their website and requesting a free appraisal kit. Once you receive the kit, you can put your coins in the package (Cash For Gold USA insures shipments up to $100,000 which helps give you peace of mind).

Once the package is received, their experts will take a look at your coins and determine their value based on metal content, weight, and current market prices. After the appraisal, you’ll receive an offer, which you can deny or accept.

At times, they also give out a bonus for your coin. For example, when I looked at their site recently, they were giving a 10% bonus. So, if they offer you $100, then they are going to give you $110 total.

Cash For Gold USA pays out via check, wire transfer, or PayPal.

Recommended reading: 16 Best Selling Apps For Selling Stuff Online And Locally

8. Coin World Marketplace

Coin World Marketplace is a site where you can connect with a community of coin collectors from around the world.

To get started selling your coins on Coin World Marketplace, create an account on their platform and register as a seller. Then, you will just need to organize your coins, gather certifications, and take high-quality photos to post on their website.

Once your coins are listed, you can talk with potential buyers and I recommend that you answer their questions quickly. Transactions are typically handled through the platform, which makes it safe and secure for both the coin seller and coin buyer.

9. Stacks & Bowers

Stacks & Bowers is a platform where serious collectors CAN go to find rare or valuable pieces. You can just go to their “Sell and Consign” page where you can consign now or request an appraisal.

You’ll have to give them all the details about your coins, including mint marks, certifications, or historical significance.

10. GreatCollections

GreatCollections is a popular site that connects collectors with sellers. You can sell both coins and paper money on this site.

To sell your coins on this site, you can just submit your coins for an appraisal through their website or by contacting them directly. If accepted, the platform will handle every part of the selling process, including photography and marketing.

Frequently Asked Questions

Below are the most commonly asked questions about selling old coins for money.

Where is the best place to sell my coins?

The best place to sell your coins depends on the type, value, and your preferred selling method (some are much easier than others!).

Some of the most popular places to sell coins include local coin shops and eBay due to the convenience and quick way to sell a collection of old coins.

If you want to get the most profit for your coin collection, visit an online platform that specializes in selling coin collections like Heritage Auctions or APMEX.

Who gives the most money for old coins? 

The value of old coins depends on several factors, including rarity, condition, historical significance, and market demand. If you want to make the most money, I recommend looking into selling your coins at auction houses like Heritage Auctions.

How do I find out what my coins are worth? 

To find out what your coins are worth, you can use online resources like coin price guides or online coin valuation tools like Coin Value Checker. You can also get an appraisal from a professional at a local coin shop.

All kinds of coins can be worth something, such as nickels, dimes, pennies, silver bullion, palladium coins, half dollars, ancient coins (such as Roman currency), proof sets, and more. One rare coin, for example, is the Saint-Gaudens Double Eagle.

How to sell coins without getting ripped off?

To sell coins without getting ripped off, it’s important to know and learn as much about the coin as you can before selling anything. So, this means that you should identify your coins, get an appraisal, or use free online coin value sites. You can also check previous auctions to see what similar coins sold for.

I also recommend that you take your coins to get multiple appraisals at coin shops or coin dealers. This will give you an idea of what to expect.

How much is a 1965 quarter worth?

The value of a 1965 quarter depends on its condition, if the coins have special features, or if the coins are rare and uncirculated. 1965 quarters in pristine, uncirculated condition sell for as much as $5,000+, whereas circulated 1965 quarters only go for less than $1. 

Where to sell old coins online? 

There are many places to sell old coins including eBay, Heritage Auctions, GreatCollections, and APMEX. Each way has a different appraisal process and takes different fees.

Where to sell old coins for cash? 

To sell old coins for cash, the best options include local coin shops, pawn shops, online bullion dealers, or auction houses like Heritage Auctions.

Who buys old coins near me?

Local coin shops, pawn shops, and coin shows are some of the best places to sell old coins near you.

Where To Sell Old Coins – Summary

I hope you enjoyed my article on the best places to sell old coins, such as silver coins, gold coins, large collections, mint sets, paper currency, and even just single coins that you may have.

Whether you have a coin-collecting hobby or you just came across a coin that you think may be worth something, there are many ways to sell coins online and in person so that you can make the most money.

As you can see, there are many ways and places to sell old coins. Where you decide to sell depends on how fast you’re trying to get rid of your coins, how much profit you want to make, and the level of convenience you’re looking for. 

When I first explored selling coins, I was surprised by how many options there were and how exciting the process could be. Whether you’re selling an heirloom collection or coins you’ve saved over the years, it’s worth taking the time to find the best place that suits your needs. Selling coins can feel overwhelming, but there are so many options these days and it’s never been easier.

Are you trying to sell old coins for cash?
